intro: Elatostema monandrum, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers with a single stamen, which is a distinctive feature of the species. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its habitat, making it a common sight in forest understories.
